intro: Dischidia tonkinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese arrowroot or climbing fig, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its aerial roots and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, starchy tubers that are used in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique growth habit and nutritional value make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
